events.originalText: Eight-year-old Huang Na was abducted and murdered; her body was found three weeks later after a search across Singapore and Malaysia.
events.subtitle: Murder of Huang Na
events.headline: Eight-year-old Huang Na abducted and murdered in Singapore; body found after three-week search

events.originalText: After 20 years of construction, Vidyasagar Setu, the longest cable-stayed bridge in India, was opened, joining Kolkata and Howrah.
events.subtitle: Vidyasagar Setu
events.headline: Vidyasagar Setu, India's longest cable-stayed bridge, opens after 20 years of construction

events.originalText: U.S. vice president Spiro Agnew (pictured) resigned after being charged with tax evasion.
events.subtitle: Spiro Agnew
events.headline: U.S. vice president Spiro Agnew resigns amid tax evasion charges

events.originalText: The Partial Nuclear Test Ban Treaty, which prohibits all test detonations of nuclear weapons except for those conducted underground, came into effect.
events.subtitle: Partial Nuclear Test Ban Treaty
events.headline: Partial Nuclear Test Ban Treaty goes into effect, prohibiting above-ground nuclear test detonations

events.originalText: World War II: The Kempeitai, the military police arm of the Imperial Japanese Army, arrested and tortured fifty-seven civilians and civilian internees on suspicion of their involvement in a raid on Singapore Harbour.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Kempeitai arrests and tortures civilians in Singapore Harbour raid during World War II

events.originalText: In the first proven act of sabotage in the history of commercial aviation, a Boeing 247 operated by United Airlines exploded in mid-air near Chesterton, Indiana, killing all seven people aboard.
events.subtitle: Sabotage
events.headline: Boeing 247 explodes mid-air in first proven act of sabotage in commercial aviation history

events.originalText: The Xinhai Revolution began with the Wuchang Uprising, marking the beginning of the collapse of the Qing dynasty and the establishment of the Republic of China.
events.subtitle: 1911 Revolution
events.headline: Xinhai Revolution begins with Wuchang Uprising, leading to collapse of Qing dynasty

events.originalText: Emmeline Pankhurst (pictured) founded the Women's Social and Political Union, a militant organisation campaigning for women's suffrage in the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Emmeline Pankhurst
events.headline: Emmeline Pankhurst founds Women's Social and Political Union for suffrage in UK

events.originalText: English astronomer William Lassell discovered Triton, the largest moon of Neptune.
events.subtitle: William Lassell
events.headline: William Lassell discovers Triton, largest moon of Neptune

events.originalText: Angry at the defeat of the Second Reform Bill a crowd burnt down Nottingham Castle, England, home of the Duke of Newcastle, who had opposed the bill in parliament.
events.subtitle: Reform Act 1832
events.headline: Crowd burns down Nottingham Castle after defeat of Second Reform Bill

events.originalText: In a treaty with Dutch colonial authorities, the Ndyuka people of Suriname gained territorial autonomy.
events.subtitle: Ndyuka people
events.headline: Ndyuka people of Suriname gain territorial autonomy in treaty with Dutch colonial authorities

events.originalText: Husayn ibn Ali, a grandson of Muhammad, was killed at the Battle of Karbala by the forces of YazidÂ I, whom Husayn had refused to recognize as caliph.
events.subtitle: Husayn ibn Ali
events.headline: Husayn ibn Ali killed at Battle of Karbala by forces of Yazid I
